p: Current use: the Janus kinase-signal transducer and activator of transcription (JAK-STAT) pathway is essential in the immune response to exogenous signals and substances. The JAK family of enzymes is responsible for signal transduction, and JAK inhibitors play a role in inhibiting cytokine release that can lead to cancer cell growth. Baricitinib, a JAK inhibitor, is used in the treatment of some types of malignancies and autoimmune diseases such as RA due to its immunomodulatory effect [ 40].
